REMINDER - Glide School District announces free curbside meal distribution for students.
Glide School District will begin offering free curbside meal pickups at Glide High School Aug. 31, Monday through Thursday. District students or their parents may pick up a grab-and-go bagged breakfast and lunches from 11 a.m. to noon. At this time, the Oregon Department of Education has given the district approval to serve meals to students attending schools within the district.

Starting Sept. 8, when the district plans to resume in-classroom learning for grades K-3 and 7-12, meals will be provided inside the building. However, curbside meal pickups will still be available for distance learning students.

For more information, including the daily menu, visit www.glide.k12.or.us. Families with questions about the program may phone the Glide School District at 541-496-3521.

Dear Parents, Staff, Students and Community Members:

Due to an unfortunate incident at a neighboring school district, GSD will no longer allow live feeds of lessons from our teachers to their classes, on Zoom.
An inappropriate video was live streamed--- to an entire class in this district.

We feel the safety of our students is a priority over these online-live lessons.

Our lessons will be pre-recorded and shared to an individual student.

Teachers are able to meet with students individually via Zoom to help with their work or to check-in with their students. These meetings will be recorded.

These protocols will enable our staff and students to be protected and remain safe to interact during these distance learning meeting times.

If you do not want your student to be involved in Zoom meetings please contact the school or the teacher via Parent Square or email.

MEDIA RELEASE

OSAA SUSPENDS PRACTICES AND CONTESTS THROUGH MARCH 31

March 13, 2020 – (Wilsonville, OR)

Per Governor Brown’s announcement regarding school closures, the Oregon School Activities Association (OSAA) has suspended interscholastic practices and contests for sports and activities for all member schools effective today through March 31.

During this suspension we will evaluate this evolving public health situation with the Oregon Health Authority, the Oregon Department of Education, the OSAA Executive Board, the OSAA Sports Medicine Advisory Committee and member school administrators from throughout the state to determine when, or if, to resume the spring season.

More information will be communicated via www.osaa.org as it becomes available.

We have learned that OSAA has granted our wish to move into a different Special District for softball. Our baseball team and softball teams were in different districts, which made no sense.
Our baseball team played locally where as our softball team had to travel great distances to play.
Both teams will now play in the 2A/1A Special District 3. You can view the Special Districts at---OSAA.org
Thank you to OSAA and to all of you who worked hard and came to our Board Meetings to help make this change happen.
This will mean less time out of school for our girls and less money for travel!

The first day was at University of Washington’s “Kids in Medicine” program, where they learned how shunts and stints are installed in hearts. The second day was at Shoreline Community College where students used DNA evidence to find a suspect in a forensics lab. The third day was at the Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center where students learned about the study of leukemia. They also had a great time exploring Pike Street Market! We want to thank the Ben Serafin committee for their continued support of this academic opportunity along with multiple other activities here in the Glide School District.
